page.title: 19MOBILE SERVICES
page.content: Although the nearby villages have modest shopping facilities,the people in the survey area are very grateful for the few mobile shops that serve them.From Steeple Bumpstead,about twelve kilometres from the centre of the area,a baker's van calls,not only supplying bread,but a good selection of groceries too.The driver is a cheerful young man who must brighten up the day for the housebound.Once a week a greengrocer calls.His base is in Saffron Walden,fifteen kilometres away.With a toot from his horn,his customers come out to his van.There is a first class selection of vegetables, and fruit to choose from,eggs too.He also has a display of fresh fish,many kinds. These are all important ingre- dients for a healthy diet, especially for people in areas where the opport- unities for shopping are limited.
